content.question: What is the “five rights” principle in logistics?

answers.option: Right supplier, right marketing, right branding, right promotion, right visibility.
Right color, right style, right design, right packaging, right label.
Right donor, right fund, right documentation, right approval, right recipient.
Right goods, right quantity, right quality, right time, right price.

content.correct: Correct! Logistics ensures goods meet quantity, quality, timing, and cost requirements.
content.incorrect: Incorrect. The correct answer is: Right goods, right quantity, right quality, right time, right price.
